page.title: 09ST.JOHN'S CHURCH, CWMBACH
page.content: The Parish Church of St. John was built in 1886 at the expense of Miss Clara Thomas of Pencerrig and cost Â£12,000. Between 1886 and 1962 there were 3 vicars but after 1962 St.John's was grouped with Llanelwedd, Llanfaredd, Llansaintfraid, Cregina and Bettws churches, all sharing one vicar,residing in Llanelwedd Rectory. Regrouping in 1984 meant that St. John's joined Newbridge, Llanafon and Llanfihangel-Brynpabuan sharing one vicar who lives in Newbridge-on-Wye Vicarage. After the Second World War attendances began to dwindle and now at the one service held each Sunday in St. John's, the average gathering is made up of about 14 women, no children and one or 2 men.The present bell- ringer, Miss May Morgan is 93 years old and is the oldest bell-ringer in Wales.
